speaker: Alice
content: Gabrielle Solis who lives down the block brought a spicy paella.
mark: block 大块，一块；街区；大楼 down the block 在街区的尽头
paella （西班牙的）肉菜饭 spicy paella

speaker: Alice
content: Since her modeling days in New York, Gabrielle had developed a taste for rich food and rich men.
mark: develop a taste for 培养对……的喜好：逐渐形成对某种事物的兴趣或喜爱。

speaker: Alice
content: Carlos, who worked in mergers and acquisitions, proposed on their third date.
mark: work in mergers and acquisitions 从事兼并与收购业务 merger （公司、组织的）合并acquisition 学得；获取；购买，添置；收购，购置的产业
propose 求婚； 提议，建议

speaker: Alice
content: Gabrielle was touched when tears welled up in his eyes.
mark: be touched 被感动
well up 涌出

speaker: Alice
content: But she soon discovered this happened every time Carlos closed a big deal.
mark: close a deal 达成交易

speaker: Alice
content: Gabrielle liked her paella piping hot.
mark: piping hot 滚烫的 piping 管道系统；尖声；笛声

speaker: Alice
content: However, her relationship with her husband was considerably cooler.
mark: considerably 非常，相当多地

speaker: Carlos
content: If you talk to Al Mason at this thing, I want you to casually mention how much I paid for your necklace.

speaker: Gabrielle
content: Why don't I just pin the receipt to my chest?
mark: pin 钉住，别住; 别针，大头针
receipt 发票，收据; 收到，接收
chest 胸部，胸膛  pin the receipt to my chest

speaker: Carlos
content: He let me know how much he paid for his wife's new convertible.
mark: convertible 活动顶篷式汽车；可换证券；可转换的，可兑换的

speaker: Carlos
content: Look, just work it into the conversation.
mark: work it into the conversation. 把它融入谈话中。
work into 添加，包含; 混合，搅拌; 逐渐使处于

speaker: Gabrielle
content: There's no way I can just work that in, Carlos.

speaker: Carlos
content: Why not? At the Donahue party, everyone was talking mutual funds. And you found a way to mention you slept with half the Yankee outfield.
mark: mutual funds 共同基金
Yankee 美国佬，美国人；洋基队（美国棒球队名）
outfield 外场；边境；偏远的田园

speaker: Gabrielle
content: I'm telling you, it came up in the context of the conversation.
mark: I'm telling you 我告诉你：表示强调，用于向对方强调某个观点或事实。
come up 提出，想出; 接近，靠近;升职，晋升;发生，出现;失败，没有结果
in the context of 在…背景下；在…情境中
in the context of the conversation 在对话的上下文中

speaker: Carlos
content: Hey, people are starting to stare. Can you keep your voice down, please?
mark: stare 凝视，盯着看

speaker: Gabrielle
content: Absolutely, We wouldn't want them to think we're not happy.
